excellent than it, and so this island, already conceived by you to be more ex-
cellent than others, will not be more excellent. If, I say, someone wishes thus to
persuade me that this island really exists beyond all doubt, I should either
think that he was joking, or I should find it hard to decide which of us I ought
to judge the bigger fool—I, if I agreed with him, or he, if he thought that he
had proved the existence of this islan
